snippet: The university canceled plans for Muslim students to deliver the traditional call from the school’s iconic chapel tower, and instead the call will be sounded from the quadrangle in front of it.
abstract: Duke University cancels plans to allow Muslim students to sound call to prayer from school's chapel tower following backlash from anti-Muslim groups, conservatives and Christian leaders; school officials say threats of violence created security concerns; announcement received little attention from community at Duke, but generated widespread and angry response online.
lead_paragraph: The university canceled plans for Muslim students to deliver the traditional call from the school’s iconic chapel tower, and instead the call will be sounded from the quadrangle in front of it.

headline.main: Amid Threats, Duke Moves Muslim Call to Prayer
headline.print_headline: Amid Threats, Duke Moves Muslim Call to Prayer
